FOTO: Nagrada junaku, ki zdrži v hiši strahov
Dvorec McKamey za uspešen podvig ponuja 18.000 evrov. Preskusa še ni prestal niti en obiskovalec.
01 Nov 2019, 16:53 by E. B.



V hiši groze je dovoljeno vse, a je vse zaigrano.



Pred vstopom je treba podpisati soglasja in predložiti zdravstveno dokumentacijo.


Bliža se noč čarovnic, ki z različnimi oblikami praznovanja priteguje tudi vse več Slovenk in Slovencev, čez lužo pa je najstrašnejši praznik v letu tradicionalno pravi spektakel. Sploh v ZDA, kjer je te dni vse v oranžno-črnih barvnih kombinacijah, v pripravi pa so tako zasebne kot javne zabave. A nikjer ne znajo tako pognati krvi po žilah kakor v dvorcu McKamey, kjer najpogumnejšemu ponujajo celo denarno nagrado, če se sprehodi po celotni hiši strahov brez odstopa. Junak bo prejel 18.000 evrov. 
Prekleto dobro zaigrano
Dvorca, ki je sprva obratoval zgolj na posestvu lastnika in idejnega očeta grozot Russa McKameyja, zdaj pa so nepredstavljive izkušnje na voljo tudi v Alabami in Tennesseeju, se drži vzdevek hiša muke. Ogled ali obisk traja od štiri do deset ur, odvisno od lokacije, do zdaj pa še nihče ni zdržal celotnega obhoda.


Pred vstopom je treba podpisati soglasja in predložiti zdravstveno dokumentacijo.

Zakaj? Ker je v notranjosti tako grozljivo, da kljub zavedanju, da je nasilje zaigrano, da na videz strupene substance, ki jih morajo obiskovalci zaužiti, v resnici niso škodljive, da so najrazličnejše pošasti in zombiji v resnici igralci in se ne bodo zares utopili, da tekočina, v katero so jim potisnili glave, ni kri, da so strašljivi zvoki posneti, da so pajki in ščurki, ki se po njih plazijo, nenevarni itn., še nihče ni bil pripravljen zaradi slave trpeti takšnega poniževanja in v igri zdržati do konca. Bo morda komu uspelo zavoljo denarja?Dvomim, se nasmiha lastnik, ki zaradi številnih tožb, češ da so katerega od obiskovalcev spravili ob duševno ali telesno zdravje, ga omamili, še naprej trpinčili kljub uporabi gesla za izstop in predajo ter ga med izkušnjo kakor koli nepopravljivo ranili, dogajanje v hiši strahov snema, vsak junak pa mora vnaprej podpisati soglasje, opraviti posebne psihične in fizične preizkušnje ter priložiti ustrezno zdravstveno dokumentacijo.»Dvorec bo kakor vedno doslej vsakogar prežvečil in ga izpljunil, to vam zagotavljam. Nihče ne bo preživel takšnega čustvenega in telesnega trpinčenja – vsakdo namreč pozabi, da je vse skupaj igra, takoj ko vstopi skozi vrata,« je prepričan McKamey, presenečen, da je čakalni seznam kljub pošastnim izkušnjam vseh dozdajšnjih nesrečnih udeležencev takoj dolg: več kot 20.000 jih namreč želi obiskati hišo groze v upanju, da se bodo proslavili kot junaki. In koliko je treba odšteti za vstopnino?
20tisoč jih je kljub pošastnemu slovesu na čakalnem seznamu.
Nič, kajti McKamey ne sprejema denarja, želi si ponujati le (bizarno) obliko zabave, ki je do zdaj sicer nasmejala samo njega. In čeprav je idejni oče najgrozljivejših potegavščin, je njegovo srce vendarle prijazno. Vsaj do živali: od obiskovalcev sprejema le hrano za pasja zavetišča, ki jih tudi sam izdatno podpira.

PHOTO: Reward for a Hero Who Endures in a House of Fears
McKamey Mansion offers $ 18,000 for a successful venture. No visitors have passed the test yet.
01 Nov 2019, 15:53 by E. B.



Everything is allowed in the house of horror, but everything is playful.



Consents must be signed and medical records must be signed before entry.


Halloween is approaching, attracting more and more Slovenes with various forms of celebration, and across the puddle, the scariest holiday of the year is traditionally a true spectacle. Especially in the US, where everything is orange-black in color these days, with both private and public parties in the pipeline. But nowhere are they able to drive blood through the veins like in McKamey Manor, where they even offer the bravest of a cash prize if they walk around the house of fear without resignation. The hero will receive € 18,000.
Damn well played
The mansion, which originally operated solely on the estate of the owner and father-in-law of the abominations of Russ McKamey, but now unimaginable experiences are also available in Alabama and Tennessee, holds the nickname house of torment. The tour or visit takes four to ten hours, depending on the location, and so far no one has withstood the entire detour.


Consents must be signed and medical records must be signed before entry.

Why? Because it's so scary on the inside that despite the awareness that the violence is playful, the seemingly toxic substances that visitors have to ingest aren't really harmful, that the wide variety of monsters and zombies are, in fact, players and won't really drown, the fluid in which their heads were pushed is not blood, the scary sounds are being recorded, the spiders and cockroaches crawling around are dangerous, etc., no one was ready for the glory to suffer such humiliation and endure in the game until the end . I doubt the owner smiles, because of the numerous lawsuits alleging that one of his visitors was mentally or physically ill stunned, he continued to suffer despite the use of a password to exit and surrender, and in the course of the experience as much as possible. irreparably wounded, the events in the house of fear are filmed, and each hero must sign the consent in advance, undergo special psychological and physical tests and attach the appropriate medical records. ”As always, the mansion will chew everyone up and spit it out, I guarantee it. Nobody will endure such emotional and physical suffering - everyone forgets that everything is a game as soon as they enter the door, "says McKamey, surprised that despite the monstrous experience of all the unlucky participants so far, the waiting list is over 20,000 He wants to visit them in the house of horror in the hope that they will be celebrated as heroes. And how much should be deducted for admission?
20 thousand of them are on the waiting list despite the monster.
Nothing, because McKamey doesn't accept money, he only wants to offer a (bizarre) form of entertainment that, until now, has only made him laugh. And although he is the father of the most dangerous pranks, his heart is kind. At least to the animals: it only accepts dog food from visitors, which it also provides extensive support for.
